title: BMW G310R showcased at Motobike Istanbul ahead of India launch : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today
text:
BMW G310R showcased at Motobike Istanbul ahead of India launch IndiaToday.in | New Delhi, February 27, 2017 | Written by Pratik Rakshit | UPDATED 14:57 IST 
BMW Motorrad will soon set up its office in India with its first product to be locally manufactured G310R. According to reports, BMW Motorrad will launch the 2017 G310R this year most likely by mid 2017. Now, before that, BMW Motorrad showcased the India-bound G310R at the Motobike Istanbul. Showcased at the EICMA 2015, the BMW G310R is jointly developed by TVS and BMW Motorrad at the TVS Group's plant in Hosur, Karnataka. 
Design: 
The BMW G 310 R carries the BMW S 1000 R genes. The sporty headlight fairing with powerful headlight, dynamic fuel tank trim and typical roadster proportions transform it into an eye-catcher on the street. The G 310 R is light and strong. The sporty seat emphasizes the roadster dynamic and gives the bike an unmistakable motorsport look. The gold anodized fork and brake calipers emphasize the workmanship of the machine. 
Engine: 
The India-bound BMW G310R will come with a displacement of 313cc with Water-cooled, single-cylinder, 4-stroke engine churning maximum power output of 34 hp @9,500 rpm and maximum torque of 28 Nm @7,500 rpm, mated to six-speed constant-mesh transmission, with a top speed of 144kmph. 
Dimensions: 
The upcoming G310R will be 1988 mm in length, 896 mm in width and 1,227 mm in height with a fuel capacity of 11L and reserve tank of 1L. 
Colors: 
The upcoming BMW G310R will come with 3 color options- Strato Blue Metallic, Cosmic Black and Pearl White Metallic. 
Competition: 
The BMW G310R will compete against the likes of Benelli TNT300, KTM Duke 390 and Bajaj Dominar 400 in India. 
Price: 
The India-bound BMW G310R will come within a price bracket of Rs 2 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi) to Rs 4 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi).
